title: Disney, Twitter, Mattel, PepsiCo, Tesla: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Disney added nearly 12 million subscribers to its streaming service; Mattel reported better-than-expected earnings during the holidays
text:
* Disney jumped 7.6% after the company said it added nearly 12 million streaming subscriptions and reported record revenue at its domestic parks and resorts.

* Mattel climbed 11% premarket after it posted better-than-expected revenue and earnings for the holiday quarter.

* Lumen Technologies dropped 12% ahead of the bell, even after it swung to an annual profit last year from a loss in 2020.

* PepsiCo added 1.1% premarket. The beverage-and-snacks giant reported fourth-quarter profit and revenue that topped expectations, boosted its dividend and set a new $10 billion stock repurchase program.

* Twitter, Coca-Cola, Interpublic Group, Datadog and Kellogg are due to report before the open.

* Equifax gained 2.8% premarket. The financial services company's profit was higher in the fourth quarter, with growth at its human resources service business boosting revenue.

* Tesla edged down 0.4%. A California regulatory agency said it filed a lawsuit against Tesla, alleging racial discrimination and harassment at the electric-vehicle maker.

* Yelp and Zillow are due to report results after the close.

Chart of the Day

* Who is feeling the price squeeze the most? Here is a demographic breakdown of inflation's impacts.
